Grant Information.grantNumber:Grant Agency: Stollery Children's Hospital Foundation; Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: This study will initiate and evaluate a 6 month online peer support network for parents of a child with a heart (HTx) or liver transplant (LTx). Specifically, study objectives comprise exploration of: (1) the effectiveness of an online network for caregiving parents of children with HTx or LTx; (2) parents' experiences and perceptions of the network; (3) the benefits/limitations of online technology for peer interaction; and (4) the means by which parents convey support within this online context.

ore:describes.Title: Evaluation of an Online Peer Support Network for Parents of Children with a Heart or Liver Transplant
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure: Approximately 50 parents were recruited to the study; 24 parents actively participated in the study.
ore:describes.socialscience:Collection Mode: Face-to-face interview; Telephone interview; Recording; Network transcript review
ore:describes.Kind of Data: Interview data; Focus group data; Survey data; Qualitative data; Clinical data
ore:describes.Data Sources: The Multidimensional Support Scale (DSS); Meaning of Illness Questionnaire (MIQ); Coping Health Inventory for Parents;
ore:describes.socialscience:Frequency: Data was collected at baseline, weekly during the duration of the group, and at 6 months.
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: Parents of children with a heart or liver transplant.
ore:describes.socialscience:Characteristics of Data Co: An analysis of the content of the entire network was conducted. Both quantitative analysis (e.g., patterns and volume of involvement per participant, number of posts, questions, replies, etc.) and qualitative-based information were analyzed from verbatim transcripts of network dialogue. An interview guide was used in post-study interviews.
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
ore:describes.schema:name: Evaluation of an Online Peer Support Network for Parents of Children with a Heart or Liver Transplant
ore:describes.dvcore:restrictions: Data collected will not become part of a data repository or be involved in the creation of a research database at a future date.
ore:describes.dvcore:conditions: Access to the data is limited to selected members of the research team.
ore:describes.schema:includedInDataCatalog: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)
